describe: South Sudan, officially known as the Republic of South Sudan, is a landlocked country in East-Central Africa. It gained independence from Sudan in 2011, making it the newest country in the world. The country is known for its diverse cultures, rich natural resources, and vast wetlands, including the Sudd, one of the world's largest wetlands.

cities.name: üèô Juba
cities.geographical_location: Located on the White Nile, Juba is the capital and largest city of South Sudan.
cities.climate: Juba has a tropical wet and dry climate, with a rainy season from April to October and a dry season from November to March.
cities.famous_cuisine: Asida (a porridge-like dish), Kisra (a type of flatbread), and grilled meats.

cities.name: üèô Wau
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the northwest of South Sudan, Wau is the capital of Western Bahr el Ghazal.
cities.climate: Wau experiences a tropical savanna climate, with a distinct wet and dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Ful medames (stewed fava beans) and local fish dishes.

cities.name: üèô Malakal
cities.geographical_location: Located in the northeast, Malakal is a major city in the Upper Nile region.
cities.climate: Malakal has a hot semi-arid climate, with a short rainy season.
